com.anifichadia.toolkit.geopartition

Class GeoPartitioner

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.anifichadia.toolkit.geopartition.GeoPartitioner

  • public class GeoPartitioner
extends java.lang.Object
    Calculates equal sized partitions for a bounding box.
    Author:
    Aniruddh Fichadia | Email: Ani.Fichadia@gmail.com | GitHub Username: AniFichadia (http://github.com/AniFichadia)

    • Method Detail

      • partition

        public static Coordinate2D[] partition(Coordinate2D c1,
                       Coordinate2D c2,
                       int numPartitions,
                       int partitionIndex)
                                throws java.lang.Exception
        Create equal sized partitions based on coordinates. Currently supports 1, 2, numbers in the square number sequence (eg. 1, 4, 16, 25, 36 ...) and powers of 2, as the number of partitions. Coordinates provided must be for the opposing corners of the bounding box. This can be the South West and North East corners, or North West and South East corners of the bounding box
        Parameters:
        c1 - First Coordinate of the original bounding box
        c2 - Second Coordinate of the original bounding box
        numPartitions - Total number of partitions
        partitionIndex - Index of the current partition
        Returns:
        2-Coordinate value array containing the coordinates for the partitioned bounding box.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception
